intro: Strobilanthes blumei var. puberula, commonly known as the hairy strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
